Understate: The claim underrepresents the incidence of white-on-white murders, which were the largest category of homicide in 2013.
Lack enough support: The claim doesn't provide enough evidence or support for its comparison of four categories of homicides.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that violence against African Americans isn't as big a problem as activists say it is.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim doesn't take into account the fact that black Americans are disproportionately killed by civilians and police, which could explain the higher incidence of homicides among African Americans.
Contradict fact: The claim misrepresents the relative frequency of white-on-white murders compared to black-on-black murders.
